runs.comm: length ball outside off, left alone. A Test-like start to the final of 2015
short of a length, on off, he opens the face to guide it to third man for one
perfect first ball. Starc has brought it. Full, just outside off at 149ks, McCullum drives, but is beaten on the inside edge. Misses the off stump by six inches. Great start from Starc
McCullum gives him the charge, Starc stays full, follows him as he backs away. No room, swinging in, beats him

Timbahhhhhhh. Starc you beauty. What a ripper [in Bill Lawry voice]. What an occasion. What a start. He blows it full, he swings it in, he lands it between the stumps and the popping crease. McCullum is tentative for once. The bat comes down late. Off stump is set back. Starc goes away on a celebratory run. MCG is on its feet. The game is not over obviously, but Starc... how is that for a start?
more swing, more pace. Some dip on it. Williamson is hit on the pad, but the ball is headed down leg
short of a length, on the pads, worked around the corner
more swing. Another outswinger. Left alone outside off
short of a length, outside off, gets chest high. Williamson thinks of playing at it, but leaves it alone late. Nerves there
strays onto the pads, Williamson misses out on the flick, but gets four leg-byes for it
full, just outside off, slight swing away, defended off the front foot
on a length, in the tentative channel outside off, left alone
more swing for Starc. That has dipped back in, Guptill seems trapped in front, but Guptill has got an inside edge onto the pad. The lbw shout is big, but they decide not to review it
short of a length. First signs the ball might not come? Guptill looks to work this to leg, but he has to wait for it, and in the end he defends it back
on a length, on off, defended from the crease
wide half-volley, Guptill plays a classy square-drive. In front of point, all along the ground. First boundary off the bat
bouncer this time, and a pretty sharp one. Pitches middle and off, and angles away. Guptill sways out of its line
on the pads this time, and he has helped it around the corner for one
wide length ball, holds its line, left alone
short of a length, wide, punched away, but can't pierce the gap at point. Smith and Warner nearly collide as both are eager to get to the ball. Warner fields this one
slight nip back in from a tight off-stump channel. Defended off the front foot

good sharp bouncer, and he has top-edged it for a six. That points to the pace, all right, but also how much the ropes have pulled in. This is not a full-blooded hook. Guptill is cramped for room with this bouncer so he hardly can swing properly, but the top edge flies over Haddin's head for six #MCGsobig
shoulders arms to one outside off
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
half-forward to defend this length ball
on a length, slight shape back in, but not too straight. Flicked towards mid-on
tentative from Kool Kane. Short of a length, on off, angling away, he is late into trying to punch this. Beaten
beats the bat again. Starc is on fire here. Short of a length again, on off, Williamson plays at it too, and is beaten by the angle
digs this in short, stays on off with the natural angle. Williamson goes low and sways out of its line

Williamson is so lucky here. Follows a wide length ball. Doesn't drive at it powerfully. Just a nothing tentative push. The ball, though, has flown off the thick edge, and over backward point. Third man comes around to field
outswinger, on a length, outside off, left alone
on a length, angling in, beats the inside edge, but is headed down leg
on a length, opens the face late on it, gets a thick edge to third man for one
short of a length, holds its line a little, defended to leg
holds its line just outside off, takes a thick edge for a single to third man
overpitches a little, strays a little, first confident stroke from Williamson as he clips this past square leg for two
bouncer, too short, too high, called a wide

this ball is too good. Almost unplayable. This is shaping to swing in, Guptill is playing for it, just outside off, but the ball pitches and seams away. Beats the edge. Another day he might have edged this
angling away this time, and Guptill doesn't play at it
short of a length, angling away from just outside off. Another leave
full and straight after having pushed it across with the angle. Guptill plays around his pad, but this is full and he makes good connection. A dive at short midwicket saves runs
again short of a length, on off, allowed to angle through to the keeper
bouncer again, this time it is head high, and Guptill ducks under it
short of a length, just outside off, holds its line slightly, beats the outside edge as he pushes at it
on a length, nipping in a little, defended off the back foot
on a length, angling in, nicely clipped away, but can't beat mid-on

that's a sharp short ball. This has come out of nowhere, and has kicked off from just short of a length. Gets shoulder high, nips back a little. Williamson thinks ramp, and pulls out at the last moment as it has got too big on him
on a length, angling in towards top of off, defended to mid-off
short of a length, seaming in, beats the inside edge to hit the pad and end a maiden
that's a sharp first ball. It is nasty. From the low round-arm release, from just short of a length, it rises towards the chest. Guptill throws his gloves up in defence. Lucky it hasn't lobbed up
again that awkward short-of-a-length delivery that is rising into the chest. Guptill is off his feet to get on top of the bounce as he fends
fuller, pitches middle, holds its line, defends off the back foot
stays back to punch this length ball to mid-off
wide down the leg side this time. Gets the line a tad wrong. Bowled at 146ks
on a length, on off, defended off the back foot. This is 148ks
short of a length, no room, punched to cover
on a length, just outside off, he leans into it and punches this back at Hazlewood who sticks a hand out, which ends up deflecting this into Guptill at the non-striker's end
mid-off is wide, and he has exploited that gap. This is a length ball outside off, he pushes it on the up, and sort of punches it straight of that man for four
digs this one in short, around chest high, and Williamson gets on top of the bounce, and rolls the wrists on the pull. Left of long leg it goes
short of a length, wide, he opens the face on it, gets a single to third man
half-volley on off, driven hard down the ground, but straight back at Hazlewood
short of a length, just outside off, good bounce, and Guptill is off his feet as he defends
sharp bouncer, on middle and leg, at 147ks, Williamson gets inside the line to look to hook, but bails out at the last moment as he realises this has got big on him
short of a length, at the hip, Williamson manages to keep it down with his defence
that is beautiful. That's an offcutter at close to 150ks. Un. Play. Able. On a length, pretty quick, on off, he has to play at it. And it cuts away to beat him
another beauty. Johnson is on today. Just a bit of that offcut again as he pitches on a length at off, and then leaves him to beat the bat
the rare half-volley, pushed away to deep cover this time
on a length, at the pads, worked away for a single to long leg
he has bowled short and wide, but so far have New Zealand been pushed back that he has cut this straight to cover point

what a bowling change. And how much has that miss on that half tracker played on Guptill's mind. Stays back to a ball slightly short than good length. He goes back to play for the offbreak and punch it. The ball turns, but not as much as he is expecting it to. Hits the top of off. Big Show on Big Stage. Also Haddin gets in Guptill's face with his applauding gloves to leave a sour note on what has been Australia's afternoon
full toss first ball, great welcome for Taylor, he drives this past cover for four
defends a full ball
turning into the pads, worked around the corner for one
half-volley outside off, lovely drive against the turn, but can't get past the diving man at cover
tucked away off the hip for a single

Johnson has looked like getting a wicket nearly every ball, and he has done so now. He has bowled excellently. His pace and aggression so far means any slight misbehaviour off the pitch is going to have a big impact. This is a length ball, around that middle and off channel. Previously balls have cut and fizzed away, this stops a touch. Only a touch, mind you. Williamson is early in defending, and lobs this back to Johnson. He is looking to work this to leg, but this has also angled away towards off, which means he has checked his shot a little
runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
full, fast and wide, Taylor drives sqyares, Warner misfields at point, contains a single
offcutter outside off, Elliott is drawn into a defensive shot, and is beaten
full ball, overpitched, middle and leg, driven down the ground, but can't beat mid-on
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
full, outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, outside off, he is forward to defend
wide length ball, it holds its line, and Taylor plays at it on the walk. Well away from the body. Beaten
this is absolutely excellent from Johnson. Bouncer from only short of a length. As in this is not dug in halfway down but has gone up higher than the shoulder. He has swayed out of it
full outside off now, defended
full, on off, defended off the front foot, in front of point, gets a single
full and wide. A half-volley. Taylor leans into it, push-drives it past cover
bouncer, pretty quick, 148ks, at the stumps. He ducks under it
full this time, outside off, Elliott - despite those two bouncers - is looking to move forward, and pushes this wide of cover
short of a length, outside off, gets good bounce, Taylor is off his feet as he defends
fuller, outside off, holds its line, hits the outside half of the bat as he defends
nice shot. This is a length ball on off, he shuffles across the line to work this past midwicket
shuffles across to a wide length ball to run it down to third man for one
short of a length, outside off, defends
on a length, on off, defended towards mid-on
short of a length, on off, he opens the face and runs this down to third man
full, outside off, defended off the back foot
moves across the line get inside the line of this length ball and works this to long leg for one
shuffles across and drops this length ball into the leg side for one
shuffles across to a length ball, defends it back to him
low full toss, flicked back to him
wide half-volley, driven to deep cover for one
low full toss, Taylor moves across to paddle this fine of fine leg. Taylor has looked on and busy today
stays back to a length ball and punches it to cover
half-volley, driven to long-on for one
nicely bowled. Attacking line outside off, the ball dips on him, meaning he is not close to the pitch of the ball. Beaten on the outside edge
wide length ball, pushed against the turn, gets a single
half-volley outside off, driven nicely, straight to short cover
wide length ball, driven with an open face, through point, comes back for two by the time third man comes around
full, pushed to mid-off, who is back at the 30-yard ring. Gets a single
on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
full, on off, pushed to mid-on, who is tight on the single
on a length, outside off, hit straight to mid-off
reverse-paddle from just outside off, past short third man. He has not bothered to turn the face of the bat. Has played it off the back of the bat
defended to leg
looks for the late cut, gets a bottom edge for one
turning into the pads, defended to leg
paddles this full ball away fine

Maxwell has got another. Big Show owning the big day. But Taylor suggests to him this could be bouncing over so they have reviewed this lbw decision. Elliott is beaten on the sweep. The ball has pitched outside off, turns in, goes under the bat, and hits him on the knee roll. Taylor seems to suggest it is going over, but the replay and Hawkeye suggest it is missing leg with the turn. Dharmasena will have to overturn his decision. Phew. That seems like a gamble that has paid off for New Zealand. This was a review in hope. A mini little clinching of fists from the two batsmen in the middle
short of a length, on off, he is on his toes to defend
hit on the pad as he is beaten by the pace, but this has pitched outside leg
full outside off, dug out towards cover
loose drive. This is on a length, angling away. He is neither close to the pitch of the ball, nor the line of it. Beaten. Loose and uncharacteristic shot
this is better from Elliott. He moves across the line to get close to this length ball, and pushes this wide of mid-off
uppishly pushed to mid-off, but well short of that man
short, not too wide, but he makes room to cut it past point for four
down the wicket to push this down the ground for one
turning into the pads, defended to leg
flighted just outside off, defended back to him
plays his favoured paddle sweep for one
length-ball offbreak, worked away for one
on a length, on off, defended with an open face
short of a length, outside off, looks for a cut, gets a bottom edge, Haddin flies to his left to save a few runs here. Lovely take
yorker this time, Elliott equal to it. Keeps this down
second top-edged six. #MCGsobig #Batedgesobig. Again this short ball gets a bit big on him, Elliott is cramped, doesn;t have any room to hook, but the top edge goes fine into the leg side
lovely yorker again. On the crease, in front of middle. He has just about got the bat down in time
length ball angling away, left alone
on a length, around off, he moves across to defend this to leg
full outside off, pushed to the right of mid-off for one
short of a length, just outside off, opens the face, can't get this past backward point
lovely shot. Elliott is looking good now. That extra cover seems to be his preferred area. Full, outside off, he stays beside the line and chips it over extra cover. Good to watch
runs this length ball to third man to bring the fifty for the partnership
he has moved too far across, is hit on the pad smack in front of middle stump, but the ball is clearly pitched outside leg. Another good save to his left by Haddin
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
on a length, middle and off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, on off, he shuffles across to work this to leg, but can;t get inside the line enough to get it square enough for a single
short of a length, wide, punched away square of deep cover. Starc makes a diving save
short of a length, on off, he tries to stay beside the line, opens the face, but can't get beat point
short of a length, wide, he deliberately plays it over point for a single
wide length ball, driven to deep cover for one
on a length, outside off, pushed with an open face, but can't beat the man at point
half-volley, outside off, he has played an excellent shot. Driving it through cover. Between mid-off and extra cover. All along the ground
good change-up. Short of a length, extra bounce with an offcutter slower ball. Beats the bat as it leaves him off the pitch
short of a length, outside off, opens the face, gets a single to third man
short of a length, no room, he cuts, but finds backward point
on a length, on off, pushed back to him
short of a length, on the stumps, and he backs away to run this down to third man for one

draws the edge but New Zealand have had a partnership going, which means there is no slip[ in place. He pushes at a length ball outside off, the ball holds its line, takes the outside edge, and goes through the vacant slip region
on a length, outside off, he shuffles across to defend it back to him
bouncer, but too short and too high. Called a wide
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
hard drive at a wide length ball, gets a thick outside edge. Third man is a little square, but he does well with that dive to save two runs
full outside off, paddles this fine of fine leg for one
opens the face on a length ball, gets a single to the left of short third man
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
pushed down the ground for one
fired into the pads, a wide down the leg side
tossed up outside off, pushed to long-off for one

tossed up wide outside off, slower through the air, Elliott is looking for the chip over cover, but the ball arrives late, and the bat face turns in his hand. He is lucky this mis-hit hasn't carried to long-off. That brings up the fifty for Elliott. Is he doing what Warne did in 1999 World Cup? Elliott was also the top-scorer in NZ's successful chase the last time New Zealand played at MCG
short of a length, pitched outside leg, hits him on the thigh pad. Concedes a leg-bye
short of a length, middle and off, moves across to defend this back to him
short of a length, outside off, leaves alone this offcutter. Bounces in front of the keeper
full, tailing back in a little, solidly defended back to him
length ball outside off, slight offcut on it, Taylor gets behind the line and opens the face to get a single to third man
full and wide, he wants the cover-drive, but gets a thick edge to third man
tossed up outside off, pushed against the turn, but not past cover
down the wicket flick this length ball into the leg side. They get two before the deep fielder can come in #MCGreallysobig
lovely delivery. Tossed up outside off, dips on him, has created the gap between his body and the pitch off the ball. Elliott ends up pushing at it. The ball doesn't turn. Beats the outside edge
half-volley this time. Driven to long-off for one
full, into the pads, can't beat short midwicket
flighted outside off, drags him across. Taylor defends this back to him
sharp bouncer, over his right shoulder, but he has pulled it well, keeping it down, gets a single to deep midwicket
short of a length, rib high, he is on his toes and bunts this into the leg side for one
on a length, on off, Elliott stays beside its line, opens the face, gets a single
length ball, on off, angling away, left alone
full and wide, he drives, gets a thick edge to third man for one
wide full fall, driven with an open face to deep cover for one
down the wicket, not to the pitch of the ball, but he has chipped it over cover-point deliberately
wide shortish ball, he opens the face on it, gets a single to the left of short third man
full, middle and off, he shuffles across to defend this to leg
down the wicket to push this down to long-on for one
another full ball into the pads, pushed down the ground for another single
another drive down to long-on. They are getting singles easily
length ball, angling in, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, no room, looks to open the face, finds backward point
short of a length, no room, opens the face, but finds backward point again
bouncer, at the stumps, Taylor doesn't go for the hook. Ducks under it
length ball into the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, angling in, he arches back to make room, gets a single to third man
he bowls short to go with his field, but Elliott ramps it late fine of third man. Opens the face late. Really late. From almost behind his body

looks to drive a length ball on the up, mis-hits it in front of point,takes the single. They shake hands to acknowledge the 100-run stand. Only the second 100-run partnership against Australia this WC
back-cuts this to third man for one
ramps this one again, just a chip to third man for one
on a length, outside off, pushed back to him
slight shape back in after pitching on a length. The inside half of the bat is hit. Elliott calls him through for a single with the ball rolling to where short leg would have been
wide down the leg side as Watson looks to deny him room
on a length, Elliott pushes for one but Taylor has pushed this straight to short straight midwicket. Sharp turn back from Elliott. He is in
good sharp bouncer from Watto, draws the top edge on the hook. Gets it really high. It falls safe in front of fine leg
punched away square on the off side. Smith leaps to field. Also lets a throw rip to send Elliott back into his crease
length ball, angling in, pushed towards mid-on for a sharp single
lovely shot. This is oh so clever, but he has kept Australia interested here. Opens the face on a shortish delivery from behind the stumps. Sends it really fine. Past the diving Haddin. Lovely touch
looks for power after touch. Dances down to a length ball, ends up dragging it to short midwicket

slower ball first up, and they have appealed for a catch at the wicket. Dharmasena has gone to the third umpire with no soft signal this time. This is a slower legcutter, nearly a yorker, really really full. Taylor looks to drive, and the ball lobs to Haddin's right. The umpires check on both counts: bump ball and a clean catch. Replays show the ball has pitched just before hitting Taylor's bat, takes the outside edge, and the edge is soft, dying to Haddin's right. He flies to his right, takes a stunning one-handed catch. This is a huge wicket. Clutch players strike first ball in the Powerplay
full and straight, full pace, defended to leg

James Faulkner. He is a big player. That's why Australia were desperate to get him fit. He is a clutch player. Both with bat and ball. He has been asked to come back in the Powerplay, and he has taken out two wickets in three balls. Slower ball to get Taylor out, followed by a normal pace length ball, and then a quick yorker. Anderson is slow on this. Beaten for pace. He has squeezed it past the bat. Rushes away towards point after hitting the off stump. On replay, this is not quite a yorker, but a really full ball that kisses the pad and hits off stump. He has done him in for pace. Slower ball was 112ks, this was 133ks
full, angling in, defended
short of a length, angling in, defended back to him
full and outside off, mis-hit to mid-off to end a double-wicket maiden. Faulkner has ruined yet another party. He is a big-time impact player

nearly a run-out. Panic all around. Short of a length, pushed to point, Elliott waits to see if Ronchi wants the one. Ronchi sets off a little late. Elliott sets off late accordingly. Smith misses with the throw. He is gone if he hits at the non-striker's end

he won't be getting it for too long as he is gone now. Lovely captaincy and lovely catch by Clarke. He has first of all placed himself at slip, and then taken a catch that looks easy on TV but isn't. Ronchi has flashed at a wide length ball, the edge has flown towards slip, Haddin makes a move towards the catch before leaving it alone for Clarke. So Clarke has done really well to not take his eye off it, and catches it superbly head high
short of a length, just outside off, he pushes at it tentatively, and is beaten
stays beside the line to push this full ball to cover
yorker, some tail back in, he stays beside the line to defend this back to Starc
bouncer, at his head, Vettori ducks under it
beats him for pace with a length ball, hits the pad, but the ball is headed down leg
short of a length, beats the inside edge as Vettori defends
full, into the pads, pushed to midwicket
this time he provides a full ball angling into the pads, Vettori pushes at it with a straight bat, beats the diving mid-on to his left
push-drives at this length ball, can't beat short cover
bouncer, head high, pulled away. Manages to keep it down somehow. Gets a single to deep backward square
full toss, cramps him, calf-high, pushed to mid-on
full from wide on the crease, bunted out into the leg side, past square leg but not hit hard enough to get to deep backward square in a hurry. Gets the second run
looks for the late cut as he arches back to a shortish delivery. Beaten by the pace
length ball, at the stumps, pushed uppishly back at him
bouncer, Vettori ducks it. This is a goodie. No room to ramp it
moves across early, and realises he has missed out on a full toss just outside off. He has limited his options through premeditation there. Ends up just pushing it to mid-on

oh that looks really really close. Turned down on the lbw appeal, but they have reviewed it. Clarke doesn't look like he has reviewed this out of conviction, but this is a tactical review because it involves Elliott. This is a length, angling in, pitches just outside off, beats the inside edge, hits him on the back pad. Not much distance to go. Looks pretty adjacent, but the prediction shows clipping the top of the stumps. Stays with the on-field call
short of a length, outside off, lovely shot by Elliott as he opens the face late to bisect point and short third man
pushes this length ball past cover for one
slower ball, angling in, really full. Defended from the crease
full, into the pads, hits this straight to midwicket. Yards either side of him, and they would have got more than one
short of a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on for one
floats a length ball outside off, beats Vettori's attempt to open the face late
shuffles across, Johnson stays outside of, he is not behind the line, gets just the single to mid-on
length ball, outside off, he opens the face, but Clarke is superb here. He has positioned himself at slip. Fields this to his right
short of a length, stays a touch low, punches this to cover
drives on the up, goes square, to the left of point, Smith makes a diving save, but they take a single off the deflection

this is top-quality bowling from Australia. Johnson has come back to completely outdo Vettori. Full inswinging yorker at a high pace. Off the round arm it comes, dipping on him, tailing back in, Vettori is late on it, is beaten on the inside edge, is hit on the pad, and the deflection rattles the stumps
short, into the body, a rare loose ball from Australia. This is short, not even chest high, and at Faulkner's pace. So he pulls it over midwicket for four
slower legcutter, beats his inside edge and also does him in for pace. Hits him on the thigh pad but this is headed down leg
looks to stay beside the line, opens the face on a length ball, finds point
short of a length, outside off, pushed with an open face

Faulkner has brought that one final big wicket. Slower ball does it again. It is so hard to pick because it comes out with the seam up. Elliot sees a length ball that he can hit over the leg side, but he is way too early into the shot. He gets the outside edge, and Faulkner's back-of-the-hand slower ball always bounces extra, which means it carries to Haddin for yet another catch. Australia all over New Zealand. A bit of a send-off again, but he gets a generous applause from the full house. raises his bat to them
yorker on off, he does well to get the bat down in time
Sixer Southee has hit a six first ball he faces. First intentional six of the innings/ #MCGsobig. Johnson bowls the slower ball, on a length, and he gets under it to loft it over long-on for a biggie
shuffles across to defend a full fast delivery
clears the front leg to drive this length ball to long-on
bouncer now. Won't be many slower balls around after that six first ball. He has to rush out of its line to protect his head
full and straight, he backs away to drive, but finds mid-off
sharp bouncer again, and no room either. He has to sway out of its line
normal pace, length ball, angling in, squeezes under his bat
short of a length, angling in, backs away to defend
short of a length, angling in, he makes room, but can't beat point with his open-face shot
slower legcutter, Southee is done in, and it follows him to beat the back-away-and-swing
this time Southee is expecting the slower ball, and makes room to chip this length ball over extra cover
drives on the up, hits the length ball straight to cover
he shuffles across to look to help a short ball to fine leg. He has guessed right, in that the ball is short, but he has been beaten by the pace
full and straight, makes room to hit this to extra cover. Won't get a single
slower ball, offcutter, he mis-hits it to long-on
short of a length, he backs away and hits, and is beaten by the angle

oh that is not the intention but they have got the wicket all the same. This is a yorker gone wrong. A low juicy full toss outside off with all the off-side fielders in the ring. Henry drives, but neither gets power behind it nor manages to keep it down. Easy catch for Starc at cover-point
tries a bouncer but is way down the leg side. Called a wide

this could be sensational. It is actually sensation regardless of the result actually. Short of a length, at the hip, defended to short leg, and Maxwell spots from the corner of his eye that Southee is a little lazy getting back into the crease at the non-striker's end. He lets rip a throw at the non-striker's end. Southee has barely a foot to go back, but Maxwell's throw has beaten him. Southee's bat has got stuck in the ground. Sensational run-out. Sums up Australia in the field today
